description.narrative:
Context: In the context of the Lebanese nation-wide protests starting October 2019 after decades of frustration about weak governance structure and widespread corruption and nepotism, and in response to the deteriorating socio-economic situation, several solidarity initiatives have emerged launched by community members, grassroots movements and local civil socity organisations (CSOs) to fundraise and provide emergency relief support to vulnerable families.
Goal: In order to allow these immediate relief initiatives to transform into long-term sustainable projects with social impact, Oxfam in Lebanon started supporting alternative local economic development solidarity initiatives. In this context, Oxfam developed 'Daleel Tadamoun' (Solidarity Directory), a citizen-led project to map and support the organic grassroot economic development solidarity initiatives that respond to immediate relief needs, and - more importantly - serves as a long-term post-uprising solution with social impact.
Objective: After a) successfully establishing a network of local partners and experts, b) mapping local initiatives, c) establishing project needs, internal structure and brand identity and d) starting a social media marketing campaign, the next phase of the projectshall now better position Daleel Tadamoun as the platform that incubates local economic development initiatives. The project aims to identify, connect, and technically support alternative local economic development initiatives across Lebanon, both offlineand online. This will be through: 1) Mapping of local economic development alternatives across all regions in Lebanon 2) Facilitate meetings and interaction between local initiatives to exchange knowledge 3) Organise meetings at the local level withlocal experts and local economic development initiatives to provide technical support and advice 4) Developing the Daleel Tadamoun WebApp 5) Share recommendations and identify lessons learned

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam has been working in Lebanon since 2006; it has a regional Gender Justice Hub that administers a regional gender justice programme and a Lebanon programme that focuses on three thematic areas of work: Humanitarian, Economic Justice, and Active Citizenship <(>&<)> Governance. Over the course of the past three years, Oxfam in Lebanon has integrated its humanitarian and development programming into a #one programme approach#, as described in the Oxfam Country Strategy. The humanitarian component of the strategy looks atthe continuation of life-saving WaSH service provision, protection services and cash assistance, while in parallel the development programs, in collaboration with local authorities and civil society, aim to address the underlying root causes of inequality and poverty over the longer-term, including through policy change. Our vision is that, by the end of 2021, marginalized women and men (Lebanese, Palestinian and Syrian populations including refugees) are protected and empowered to enjoy their basic rights, enabling them to live in dignity within a more equitable society. Oxfam in Lebanon has a main office in Beirut, and two operational offices in Zahle (Bekaa governance) and Tripoli (North governance).

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to social and political participation
